accused.name: Synnel Stumpff
accused.residence: Amange (modern Insming, 17 km east of Morhange)

confession.seduction_context: Husband often beat her, went out one autumn night when man approached offering good advice if she would serve him. Refused first time, but yielded on second occasion when he offered to make her rich so that she would never want
powder_types: powder made from burned unbaptised child's body
sabbat_activities: wedding feast with wine and meat but little bread and no salt
noce de saba where grand-daughter of la Grosse Mairesse (aged about 10) was given to 'un beau jeune diable'
travelled on forks or brooms anointed with special grease

testimony.quarrel_subject: fined her over trespassing animals when he was bangard

harms_alleged.harm_description: saw Synnelle in front of her as she went to pick cherries, then a wind took her, became ill for 16 weeks and died
great illness he thought had been witchcraft, although did not know who was responsible

witnesses.name: Stephen Schwab
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, husband of la grosse Anne

harms_alleged.harm_description: unconscious and unable to speak for several days
harms_alleged.precipitating_quarrel: Synelle approached her by the spring
harms_alleged.method_alleged: struck by wind which blew her hair around

witnesses.name: La grosse Anne
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, daughter-in-law's mother (Odille married Synnel's son Hanns Mulnier)

harms_alleged.harm_description: illness that started when she was doing washing
harms_alleged.precipitating_quarrel: Synelle would have liked to have a barn which they had bought

harms_alleged.target: many animals including the black cow
harms_alleged.harm_description: heard mother-in-law say 'va, va en l'estable de la grosse Anne sur la noire vache'

witnesses.name: Françoise femme Colas le Petit Masson
witnesses.occupation: former servant in prévôté of Amange

harms_alleged.harm_description: arm painful since encounter, making it difficult to work
taken out of stable and found dead next day as if roasted
ill for 9 weeks, and head still started spinning when she had to cross bridges

testimony.threat_quote: rien de bon (when asked what the weather would be)

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused her of being a witch after seeing her jumping over hedges during storm
testimony.threat_quote: Said she would take action if she had witnesses, adding 'qu'il luy feroit volontier perdre son bien d'aultant qu'il n'avoit rien a perdre'

witnesses.name: Jean fils Schu Adam
witnesses.occupation: in service at Weitzem, former servant of accused

testimony.threat_quote: Que parle tu, ton pere s'en ressentira (to son of Thiebault Cordonnier)

harms_alleged.harm_description: bad arm with open place he had been unable to get healed, told he would suffer from it for his life

testimony.quarrel_subject: had cows on lease from her which she took back before term - he was angry and called her witch

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: C.M. Rémy asks for arrest, interrogation, and confrontations

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: Court at Dieuze approves arrest and interrogation

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: C.M. Rémy asks for question ordinaire

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: Lifted up on strappado six times, would not confess. Asked for time to reflect and was taken down overnight

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: As executioner started to lift her up, offered to confess. Confessed to being seduced 18 years earlier, sabbat attendance, making hail, killing animals and people

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: Repeated earlier confessions, confronted with Synnelle femme Schur Adam

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: C.M. Rémy asks for execution after confrontation with all those she accused

timeline.subject: Synnel Stumpff
timeline.details: Change de Nancy reiterates objections to misuse of torture, requires further free confession before sentence is confirmed

accomplices_named.name: la Grosse Mairesse
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice in burning unbaptised child to make powder, killing horses, killing la grosse Anne's cow, killing wife of Demenge Schwitzer, killing child of prévôt, and attending sabbats

accomplices_named.name: Synnelle femme Schur Adam
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice in burning unbaptised child to make powder, killing wife of Demenge Schwitzer, and attending sabbats. Also under arrest and confronted with accused

accomplices_named.name: Odille femme Henry Cousturier
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice in burning unbaptised child to make powder, killing wife of Demenge Schwitzer, and attending sabbats. Also seen by frère Pierre at priory

accomplices_named.name: la grosse Anne
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice in burning unbaptised child to make powder and attempting to waste crops at Kinguier

accomplices_named.name: Else (daughter of Schect)
accomplices_named.context: Named as holding horse's head while it was killed

accomplices_named.name: wife of Nickel Marchal
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice in killing la grosse Anne's cow and as bride at sabbat wedding feast

accomplices_named.name: daughter of Hanns Schneider, wife of Nicklas Marchal
accomplices_named.context: Named as holding wife of Demenge Schwitzer while drink was given to kill her

accomplices_named.name: wife of Hanns Schneider
accomplices_named.context: Named as giving drink to kill child of prévôt of Amange

accomplices_named.name: Mayette daughter of Woitsche Thiebault
accomplices_named.context: Named as present at sabbat wedding feast

notable_quotes.speaker: Synnel Stumpff
notable_quotes.french: Mon dieu est ce maintenant a moy, il ne demeura long temps qu'il n'en vienne encor d'aultres
notable_quotes.english: My God is it now my turn, it will not be long before others come too
notable_quotes.context: Said to Stoffel Marchal when he was appointed to escort her to Dieuze

notable_quotes.speaker: Synnel Stumpff
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit menty comme une cocquine, sorciere, et larronnesse, que l'escorcheur luy avoit bien dict que ce fasoit elle mesme qui fasoit mourir ses bestes et qu'elle avoit quatre fois mieulx meritée d'estre en prison qu'elle
notable_quotes.english: that she had lied like a scoundrel, witch, and thief, that the knacker had told her it was herself who was killing her animals and that she deserved to be in prison four times more than she did
notable_quotes.context: Accused's angry response to la grosse Anne's testimony during confrontations

notable_quotes.speaker: Synnel Stumpff
notable_quotes.context: Reply to Bonnen Petter when he asked her what the weather would be like as a storm threatened

notable_quotes.speaker: Schu Thiebault
notable_quotes.french: qu'il luy feroit volontier perdre son bien d'aultant qu'il n'avoit rien a perdre
notable_quotes.english: that he would gladly make her lose her property since he had nothing to lose
notable_quotes.context: Said to accused after calling her a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: la grosse Anne's mother-in-law (Synnel Stumpff)
notable_quotes.french: va, va en l'estable de la grosse Anne sur la noire vache
notable_quotes.english: go, go to the stable of la grosse Anne to the black cow
notable_quotes.context: Overheard by her niece Odille telling hens where to go at night

notable_quotes.speaker: son of Thiebault Cordonnier
notable_quotes.french: O sorciere que vous estéz, que faictes vous icy
notable_quotes.english: O witch that you are, what are you doing here
notable_quotes.context: Said to accused when he saw her at foot of his bed at night after using thumb technique to speak

notable_quotes.speaker: Synnel Stumpff
notable_quotes.french: Que parle tu, ton pere s'en ressentira
notable_quotes.english: What are you saying, your father will suffer for it
notable_quotes.context: Threat to son of Thiebault Cordonnier

notable_quotes.speaker: C.M. Rémy (marginal note)
notable_quotes.french: Seront adverties les sieurs gens de justice ceste parte qu'il n'est permis d'iterer la question par interval de jour a autre et qui s'en debvront abstenir a l'advenir a peine d'en estre poursuivies en leurs pure et privé nom par le procureur general de quoy il proteste
notable_quotes.english: The lords of justice will be warned on this matter that it is not permitted to repeat torture at intervals of one day to another and they must abstain from this in future under penalty of being prosecuted in their personal and private names by the procureur general, which he protests
notable_quotes.context: Legal objection to improper torture procedure

relationships.evidence_text: Her niece Odille had married Senelle's son Hanns Mulnier

economic_context.details: La grosse Anne testified that Synelle would have liked to have a barn which they had bought, suggesting property jealousy as motive. Witness Schur Adam had dispute over cows leased from accused which she took back before term. Bonnen Petter testified that horse owner (Britz de Nelling) suspected her because he had ceased to use her mill, indicating loss of business.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused arrived at spring where victim was sitting
witness as bangard had to fine her over trespassing animals
witness as bangard had to fine her over trespassing animals

great illness thought to be witchcraft
unconscious and unable to speak for several days during previous carnival
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Synelle approached her by the spring
harms_catalog.method_alleged: struck by wind which blew her hair around
heard mother-in-law tell hens to go to stable to black cow

harms_catalog.harm_description: arm painful since encounter, making it difficult to work

harms_catalog.method_alleged: grasped arm, saw figure with strange light between hands

harms_catalog.harm_description: taken out of stable and found dead next day as if roasted
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: same night as witness was attacked

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 9 weeks, head still started spinning when she had to cross bridges
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: previous year when guarding cattle at Amange

material_culture.context: servant told to bring pot to fields, but broke it against oak tree, contained oak leaves and 'choses sales et vilaines'
grenier filled with oak leaves after pot incident
seen riding distaff in air, distaff fell to ground and was pushed into water
sons of Frantz and Thomas Colas saw her riding a fork; traveled on forks or brooms to sabbat
traveled on brooms anointed with special grease to sabbat
used to anoint forks or brooms for travel to sabbat
Stephen Schwab took his wife's urine sample to woman healer at Riche for diagnosis
healer at Riche gave water for wife to drink as treatment
widow Marie saw accused with blue candle before bed
used candles that gave little light at sabbat, did not know how they were made
devil gave her horsedung as powder
burned unbaptised child's body kept for 3 days and nights to make powder
served at sabbat wedding feast
little bread at sabbat feast
no salt at sabbat feast
schoolmaster taking holy water round village, accused refused saying she could fetch it herself; said she was too poor to give normal quarter loaf for holy water
said she had never been able to swallow communion host since becoming witch; took it home and gave it to children
la grosse Anne testified Synelle wanted barn which they had bought
la grosse Anne took her linen when her house burned down
Schur Adam had cows on lease from her which she took back before term

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, residence of accused and most witnesses, 17 km east of Morhange
Court location where accused was taken for trial
Birthplace of accused
Where accused went into service and was married
Where accused lived for 5 years after marriage
Where storm did much damage to crops
Location of woman healer who was consulted
Location where la grosse Anne encountered accused and fell ill
Residence of witness Marie veuve
Location of tuillerie where witness Françoise worked, residence of René de Villiers
Where Jean fils Schu Adam was in service
Location where accomplices met to burn unbaptised child to make powder
Where witches were told to waste crops but failed because grain was too ripe
Where witches went to destroy acorns 10 years before
Location of sabbat wedding feast
Location of 'noce de saba' where young girl was given to devil
Home of Mayette daughter of Woitsche Thiebault
Where witches met to destroy pears and acorns but were chased away
Where frère Pierre became curé
Where devil took form of wolf to kill sheep but was prevented
Where René de Villiers encountered accused carrying pot with oak leaves
Where frère Pierre saw accused and Odille femme Henry Cousturier by his bed
Location of woman who might be able to heal arm injury
Location of Change de Nancy (appeals court)

weather_events: great storm within hour of seeing accused jumping between hedges with wild hair, did much damage to crops at Bocknom (10 years earlier)
great storm coming up when sergent saw accused jumping over hedges with clouds following her (9 years earlier)
great wind when accused arrived at spring where la grosse Anne was sitting
wind that struck la grosse Anne and blew her hair around after encounter with accused
economic_hardship_indicators: accused said she was so poor she could not give schoolmaster normal quarter of a loaf for holy water
loss of mill customers as possible motive
religious_calendar_references: previous carnival (when la grosse Anne fell ill)

legal_context.redress_outcome: When Schu Thiebault called her witch, she said she would take action if she had witnesses, but took no action. When Schur Adam called her witch, her servant pointed this out to her but she said he did not know what he was saying and took no action

hearsay_chains.content: when schoolmaster had cow dead he suspected her, and she asked why he had not sought drink from her earlier which might have healed it
she had made la grosse Anne ill

hearsay_chains.source: sons of Frantz and Thomas Colas
hearsay_chains.content: had seen her riding a fork
storm did much damage to crops at Bocknom
she had been seen up a tree using birds to take grain to her loft
she had been seen jumping among hedges and bushes

hearsay_chains.source: son of Schu Thiebault (absent at present)
hearsay_chains.content: he had seen her at foot of his bed by night
when alone in house heard noise in kitchen which frightened her, thought it might be Senelle trying to do her harm

hearsay_chains.source: frère Pierre, now curé at Munster
hearsay_chains.content: when he was at priory of Amange saw her and Odille femme Henry Cousturier by his bed with heads together; they vanished when he called out. Also thought she killed his horse worth 50 écus

emotional_state_notes: After hearing la grosse Anne's testimony, became angry and called her 'cocquine, sorciere, et larronnesse'
During first torture session lifted six times but would not confess
Asked to be allowed a relapse and taken down overnight
As executioner started second torture session, immediately offered to confess
When confronted with Synnelle femme Schur Adam, maintained charges - the other tried to attack her but was prevented

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Called la grosse Anne 'cocquine, sorciere, et larronnesse', said the knacker told her it was herself killing her own animals and that she deserved to be in prison four times more
Said her grandson might well have taken distaff since he took everything he could find out of the house
Asked that they produce the maid who had carried the pot
Said widow Marie was a vagabond
Said she was so poor she could not give him normal quarter of a loaf for holy water, had obtained it from church on Sundays
Repeated suggestion that he was beaten by master because of relationship with mistress

third_parties.name: schoolmaster
third_parties.context: Had cow die, suspected accused, she asked why he had not sought drink from her earlier which might have healed it

third_parties.name: sons of Frantz and Thomas Colas
third_parties.context: Reportedly saw accused riding a fork

third_parties.name: lame girl who lived with accused
third_parties.context: Came to look at dead mare being cut up

third_parties.name: Hanns fils Diebelt
third_parties.context: Saw accused by his bed one night, could not speak; presently absent during trial

third_parties.name: woman healer at Riche
third_parties.context: Consulted about la grosse Anne's illness, diagnosed 'un mauvais vent', gave healing water

third_parties.name: Marie (sister-in-law of Jean Cordonnier)
third_parties.context: Claimed to have been frightened by seeing accused at foot of bed

third_parties.name: Nickel from Kigner
third_parties.context: Told Jean Tixerant that accused had been seen up tree using birds to take grain to her loft

third_parties.name: son of Schu Thiebault
third_parties.context: Reportedly saw accused at foot of his bed by night; absent at present

third_parties.name: son of Thiebault Cordonnier
third_parties.context: Saw accused at foot of bed at night, used right thumb technique to speak, she threatened him

third_parties.name: Britz de Nelling
third_parties.context: Owner of horse that drowned in shallow stream, suspected accused because he ceased to use her mill

third_parties.name: Capitaine Melon
third_parties.context: Was with René de Villiers when they encountered accused with pot containing oak leaves (now deceased)

third_parties.name: frère Pierre
third_parties.context: Now curé at Munster, reportedly saw accused and Odille femme Henry Cousturier by his bed at priory of Amange, thought accused killed his horse worth 50 écus

third_parties.name: Schect
third_parties.context: Named in confession as present when horse was killed, father of Else

third_parties.name: daughter of Hanns Schneider, wife of Nicklas Marchal
Mayette daughter of Woitsche Thiebault of Nelling
third_parties.context: Named as present at sabbat wedding feast

third_parties.name: grand-daughter of la Grosse Mairesse
third_parties.context: Aged about 10, given to 'un beau jeune diable' at sabbat near Nelling

third_parties.name: Colmans Nickel
third_parties.context: Owner of mare that witches killed according to confession

third_parties.name: child of prévôt of Amange
third_parties.context: Named in confession as killed by witches

third_parties.name: unbaptised child
third_parties.context: Body kept for 3 days and nights then burned to make powder

prior_accusations.context: Named as accomplice in confession, already executed

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial ended with Change de Nancy requiring further free confession before sentence confirmation due to objections about misuse of torture (repeating torture on consecutive days). Final outcome uncertain - no execution or release recorded in document. Extensive witness testimony (28 witnesses) and detailed confession under torture naming multiple accomplices. Notable for judicial intervention regarding torture procedures.
